verses.verse: And it came to pass in the eleventh<WH6249> year<WH8141>, in the first<WH259> day of the month<WH2320>, that the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> came unto me<WH559>, saying,

Son <WH1121> of man<WH120>, because that Tyre<WH6865> hath said<WH559> against Jerusalem<WH3389>, Aha<WH1889>, she is broken<WH7665> that was the gate<WH1817> of the peoples<WH5971>; she is turned<WH5437> unto me<WH4390>; I shall be replenished, now that she is laid waste<WH2717>:

therefore thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069>, Behold<WH6865>, I am against thee, O Tyre, and will cause many<WH7227> nations<WH1471> to come up<WH5927> against thee<WH3220>, as the sea causeth its waves<WH1530> to come up<WH5927>.

And they shall destroy<WH7843> the walls<WH2346> of Tyre<WH6865>, and break down<WH2040> her towers<WH4026>: I will also scrape<WH5500> her dust<WH6083> from her<WH5414>, and make her a bare<WH6706> rock<WH5553>.

She shall be a place for the spreading<WH4894> of nets<WH2764> in the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220>; for I have spoken<WH1696> it<WH5002>, saith the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069>; and she shall become a spoil<WH957> to the nations<WH1471>.
And her daughters<WH1323> that are in the field<WH7704> shall be slain<WH2026> with the sword<WH2719>: and they shall know<WH3045> that I am Jehovah<WH3068>.

For thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069>: Behold<WH935>, I will bring upon Tyre<WH6865> Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>, king<WH4428> of kings<WH4428>, from the north<WH6828>, with horses<WH5483>, and with chariots<WH7393>, and with horsemen<WH6571>, and a company<WH6951>, and much<WH7227> people<WH5971>.

He shall slay<WH2026> with the sword<WH2719> thy daughters<WH1323> in the field<WH7704>; and he shall make<WH5414> forts<WH1785> against thee<WH8210>, and cast up a mound<WH5550> against thee<WH6965>, and raise up the buckler against thee<WH6793>.
And he shall set<WH5414> his battering<WH6904> engines<WH4239> against thy walls<WH2346>, and with his axes<WH2719> he shall break down<WH5422> thy towers<WH4026>.

By reason of the abundance<WH8229> of his horses<WH5483> their dust<WH80> shall cover<WH3680> thee<WH2346>: thy walls shall shake<WH7493> at the noise<WH6963> of the horsemen<WH6571>, and of the wagons<WH1534>, and of the chariots<WH7393>, when he shall enter<WH935> into thy gates<WH8179>, as men enter<WH3996> into a city<WH5892> wherein is made a breach<WH1234>.

With the hoofs<WH6541> of his horses<WH5483> shall he tread down<WH7429> all thy streets<WH2351>; he shall slay<WH2026> thy people<WH5971> with the sword<WH2719>; and the pillars<WH4676> of thy strength<WH5797> shall go down<WH3381> to the ground<WH776>.

And they shall make a spoil<WH7997> of thy riches<WH2428>, and make a prey<WH962> of thy merchandise<WH7404>; and they shall break down<WH2040> thy walls<WH2346>, and destroy<WH5422> thy pleasant<WH2532> houses<WH1004>; and they shall lay<WH7760> thy stones<WH68> and thy timber<WH6086> and thy dust<WH6083> in the midst<WH8432> of the waters<WH4325>.
And I will cause the noise<WH1995> of thy songs<WH7892> to cease<WH7673>; and the sound<WH6963> of thy harps<WH3658> shall be no more heard<WH8085>.

And I will make<WH5414> thee a bare<WH6706> rock<WH5553>; thou shalt be a place<WH4894> for the spreading<WH4894> of nets<WH2764>; thou shalt be built<WH1129> no more<WH3068>: for I Jehovah have spoken<WH1696> it<WH5002>, saith the Lord<WH3068> Jehovah<WH136>.

Thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069> to Tyre<WH6865>: shall not the isles<WH339> shake<WH7493> at the sound<WH6963> of thy fall<WH4658>, when the wounded<WH2491> groan<WH602>, when the slaughter<WH2027> is made<WH2026> in the midst of thee<WH8432>?

Then all the princes<WH5387> of the sea<WH3220> shall come down<WH3381> from their thrones<WH3678>, and lay aside<WH5493> their robes<WH4598>, and strip off<WH6584> their broidered<WH7553> garments<WH899>: they shall clothe<WH3847> themselves with trembling<WH2731>; they shall sit<WH3427> upon the ground<WH776>, and shall tremble<WH2729> every moment<WH7281>, and be astonished at thee<WH8074>.

And they shall take up<WH5375> a lamentation<WH7015> over thee<WH559>, and say to thee<WH6>, How art thou destroyed, that wast inhabited<WH3427> by seafaring men<WH3220>, the renowned<WH1984> city<WH5892>, that was strong<WH2389> in the sea<WH3220>, she and her inhabitants<WH3427>, that caused<WH5414> their terror<WH2851> to be on all that dwelt there<WH3427>!
Now shall the isles<WH339> tremble<WH2729> in the day<WH3117> of thy fall<WH4658>; yea<WH339>, the isles that are in the sea<WH3220> shall be dismayed<WH926> at thy departure<WH3318>.

For thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH136>: When I shall make<WH5414> thee a desolate<WH2717> city<WH5892>, like the cities<WH5892> that are not inhabited<WH3427>; when I shall bring up<WH5927> the deep<WH8415> upon thee<WH7227>, and the great waters<WH4325> shall cover thee<WH3680>;

then will I bring thee down<WH3381> with them that descend<WH3381> into the pit<WH953>, to the people<WH5971> of old time<WH5769>, and will make thee to dwell in the nether parts<WH8482> of the earth<WH776>, in the places<WH8482> that are desolate<WH2723> of old<WH5769>, with them that go down<WH3381> to the pit<WH953>, that thou be not inhabited<WH3427>; and I will set<WH5414> glory<WH6643> in the land<WH776> of the living<WH2416>.

I will make<WH5414> thee a terror<WH1091>, and thou shalt no more have any being<WH1245>; though thou be sought for, yet shalt thou never<WH5769> be found<WH4672> again<WH5002>, saith the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069>.
